author: elecharny
msg: A major fix. When we had a sub-grammar (like LdapResult) into a grammar, and when this sub-grammar is following by
some other elements to parse, the decoder was simply not working. This has been fixed by adding a state stack to
store the current state before the switch, and some controls when we are coming back from a swicth to know when we
have to pursue the decoding on the current grammar or finishing it.
Fortunatly, this leads to some simplification in all the grammars, as we don't anymore have to deal with the
following states when leaving a sub-grammar.

author: aheritier
msg: RE-Fix MPXDOC-136: Fix lost with Vincent's patch.

author: elecharny
msg: - the restoreGrammar method now return the previous state before the grammar switch

author: elecharny
msg: - added a states stack, to be able to continue the parsing when coming back from a grammar switch
- modified the grammarSwitch method, which take one more parameter : the current state

author: elecharny
msg: Added some class logger definition, to be more accurate while debugging
